DOC.brief_summary: Cocaine-use disorders continue to be a significant public health concern, yet no effective medications have been identified. The goal of this study is to establish a research platform for the development of medications for treatment of cocaine abuse and dependence. This study will incorporate self-administration procedures and a non-drug alternative reinforcer, which is hypothesized to reduce the reinforcing effects of cocaine.
DOC.brief_title: Impact of a Non-Drug Choice on Cocaine Reinforcement
DOC.criteria: Cocaine dependence, otherwise healthy Laboratory results outside of clinically acceptable ranges, history of or current serious physical or psychiatric disease
